Class boardview

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Canvas
              |
              +--boardview
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.lang.Runnable, java.io.Serializable
public class boardview
extends java.awt.Canvas
implements java.lang.Runnable

a boardview is a canvas (a rectangle that can be displayed on the screen and painted on) that can display a board. It can be used in two ways

  1. by an applet. In this case the boardview listens to the mouse, and lets the players do moves. It also starts an animation for fading in any changes.
  2. By genetictrain. Animation is no longer needed, and it does not listen to the mouse.

See Also:
Serialized Form

setplayers

public void setplayers(boolean a,
                       boolean b)
you can indicate here whether computer players must be used.
Parameters:
a - true if a computer player must be used for the first player. False if the user operates this player.
b - same for second player.

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics newg)
this method is called by the operating system if the frame must be redrawn, and by the rest of the program if something changed on the board. It is synchronized because genetictrain calls this method very often, and we do not want these paints to happen in parallel.
Overrides:
paint in class java.awt.Canvas

answer

public void answer(java.lang.String s,
                   int m)
this method is called by movers to return return the move they want to do.
Parameters:
s - s is not used. It is a little joke: it can be used by callers to give a comment to this function.
m - the move to be done.

start

public void start()
is called if a new thread is created for the animation.

stop

public void stop()
is called if someone wants the thread to stop.

run

public void run()
this method is the one that runs in its own thread to do the animation. it calls fade() every 150 milliseconds.
Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
